;黑色星期五？不，网络星期一？没有。黄金日？绝对不。世界上最大的购物活动每年都在中国举行，这天被称为“光棍节”。

;

;原本是一个庆祝单身的节日，作为情人节的反面，该​​活动已发展成为为期数周的在线购物活动节日高峰期为 11 月 11 日。

;

;光棍节的想法起源于 1993 年的中国南京大学，最初被称为“单身汉节”。在这一天，单身人士会用礼物和礼物犒赏自己，同时也会组织社交聚会和聚会。

;

;去年，购物热潮（又称“双11”）期间销售的商品总价值-根据咨询公司贝恩的数据，总计 1.15 万亿元人民币（1,579.7 亿美元）。

;

;这是去年美国消费者在网络周（黑色星期五到网络星期一）期间花费的 353 亿美元的四倍多，根据 Adob​​e Analytics 的数据。

;

;网络星期一紧随黑色星期五之后，黑色星期五恰逢美国感恩节假期的第二天，这是美国一年中最繁忙的购物日。

;<但尽管“双十一”整体销售额创下历史新高，但增长速度却一直在放缓，去年的 3% 增幅是有史以来最慢的增幅。近年来，随着中国其他购物节的兴起，包括中国第二大年中“618”促销活动，该活动失去了一些新鲜感。

;

;“我们对今年的增长持乐观态度，因为复苏似乎正在趋于稳定，消费也在持续增长。”更明显的上升趋势。”总部位于北京的 WPIC Marketing + Technologies 联合创始人兼首席执行官 Jacob Cooke 表示。

;

;他的电子商务咨询公司预计中国购物活动的销售额将在较去年增长 14% 至 18%，高于 Adob​​e 对网络周销售额增长 5.4% 的预测。

;

;虽然 ;阿里巴巴9988.HK于2009年启动“双11”;，以折扣和促销吸引网购消费者，中国主要电商平台现在大家都参与其中。

;

;京东;(9618.HK ); 于 2012 年加入，PDD Holdings 旗下;(PDD.O); 拼多多也已成为重要参与者，提供低成本产品与 ;阿里巴巴旗下天猫和淘宝平台;。

;

;去年，;中国消费者在必需品、补充剂、维生素和宠物护理产品上的支出更高;。这些产品以及运动服装和运动器材等更多以生活方式为中心的产品预计今年将继续保持需求。

;

;“中国消费者对改善生活方式和生活质量的产品和服务有着巨大的需求。库克说。

;

;相比之下，去年美国消费者在黑色星期五和网络星期一的关键购物时段购买了更多的口袋妖怪玩具、风火轮、电视、鞋类和空气炸锅。

;

;从 2014 年到 2021 年，光棍节有;平均每年增长率约为 34%;，而网络周的平均增长率为 17%。

;

;美国卫生机构进行的癌症和死亡率研究发现，生活和工作的军事和文职人员的癌症发病率较高一位熟悉这项研究的流行病学家表示，在美国主要军事基地勒琼营 (Camp Lejeune) 进行的研究。

;

;有关研究结果的报告已于 4 月份提交，但有毒物质和疾病登记局尚未发布，激怒了那些自称从 1953 年到 1987 年在北卡罗来纳州杰克逊维尔附近的海军陆战队基地饮用受污染的水而生病的人。

;

;据报道，这项研究增加了已知的与该基地受污染的饮用水相关的癌症数量前国家癌症研究所流行病学家肯尼思·坎托 (Kenneth Cantor) 读过该研究。坎托说，这些发现还提供了迄今为止最有力的证据，证明受污染的水会导致癌症。

;

;美国政府已经面临着向那些声称因饮用水受到燃料污染而受到伤害的工人和居民支付数十亿美元的潜在赔偿金来自 Camp Lejeune 井的溶剂和其他毒素。他们已向美国政府提出了超过 117,000 份赔偿要求，并处理了超过 1,320 起民事案件。

;

;像这样的研究（显示癌症发病率上升，且有强大的对照组）可能会鼓励更多原告起诉美国政府，维克森林大学法学院专门研究环境侵权案件的教授乔纳森·卡迪说。卡迪没有看过这份报告。

;

;迈克尔·帕坦 (Michael Parttain) 表示，延迟发布该报告相当于隐瞒证据。迈克尔·帕坦小时候住在勒琼营，目前正在就罕见的男性乳腺癌病例起诉政府。他在 39 岁时患上了这种疾病。

;

;“通过推迟报告，ATSDR 正在帮助政府在勒琼营地免遭责任，因为这些报告对于了解我们暴露的影响至关重要，”帕坦说.

;

;ATSDR 主任 Aaron Bernstein 表示，认为 ATSDR 正在审议该报告是一种错误的描述。

;

;在 4 月份完成同行评审后，ATSDR 于 6 月份启动了统计评审。伯恩斯坦说，第二次同行评审将审查作者对该报告所做的修改，但尚未完成。在作者对第二次同行评审做出回应后，该报告将接受 ATSDR 内的多个办公室的审查，然后很可能是 CDC 内的多个办公室的审查。

;

;Bernstein 无法透露他预计该机构何时会批准该报告。发布报告。 “我们有一个流程，”他说。

;

;该报告的作者、ATSDR 和疾病控制中心的高级流行病学家 Frank Bove 表示，该报告现在应该已经发布了。

;< “我对这个过程感到沮丧，”博夫在 10 月份勒琼营地社区援助小组的一次会议上说道，该小组的成立是为了向 ATSDR 提供关于该基地研究的建议。 Bove 拥有三十年的经验，撰写了至少 20 项 ATSDR 研究。

;

;国会创建 ATSDR 是为了评估美国毒性最强的废物场的健康风险。路透社对该机构过去 11 年发布的 400 多份报告进行了审查，发现有些报告是在几个月内发布的，而另一些则花了数年时间。 Lejeune 营癌症和死亡率研究始于 2015 年。

;

;Bove 使用美国每个癌症登记处的数据来记录 1996 年至 1996 年至 1996 年期间患癌症的 Lejeune 营军事人员和平民中某些癌症发病率的升高。 2017 年。坎托尔说，他将勒琼营的费率与彭德尔顿营的费率进行了比较，彭德尔顿营是加州海军陆战队基地，该基地没有受燃料污染的饮用水。

;

;坎托尔在同行期间收到了一份报告副本审查过程，向路透社描述为“开创性”。

;

;1997 年的一份 ATSDR 报告因忽视了勒琼营受污染水的健康问题而引起了国会以及基地前居民和工作人员的广泛批评。作为回应，国会命令 ATSDR 研究在那里服务、生活和工作的人们的癌症和死亡率。 2009 年，在社区援助小组成员获得显示饮用水受到危险水平的燃料污染的政府文件后，该机构撤回了 1997 年的研究。

;美国总统乔·拜登周五的连任竞选活动将报名参加南卡罗来纳州民主党初选，这是该党的首次正式冲突，也是对一位顽强的总统的早期热情考验最近的一系列民意调查显示黑人选民的支持率下降。

;

;该州 2 月 3 日的初选将是拜登自 2020 年以来首次面临有争议的选举，与远投的机会进行对决 ;迪恩·菲利普斯;，明尼苏达州国会议员、自助大师;玛丽安·威廉姆森。;

;

;这将标志着回到指出拜登将他推入白宫的功劳。虽然拜登不太可能面临激烈的竞争，但在一个大多数民主党选民都是黑人的州，初选投票率强劲将平息人们对拜登 2024 年当选的担忧。

;

;“尽管我们知道乔·拜登将会获胜民主党全国委员会成员、帕尔梅托州长期居民卡罗尔·福勒 (Carol Fowler) 表示：“在初选时，我们希望通过投票来表达对总统的热情和支持。”

;

;拜登 < a href="/world/us/good-bye-iowa-democrats-approve-bidens-revamped-primary-calendar-2023-02-04/">;将爱荷华州和新罕布什尔州从排行榜上的榜首赶下;该党的提名日历有利于南卡罗来纳州。此举迫使拜登的任何民主党挑战者首先在南卡罗来纳州竞争，而不是爱荷华州和新罕布什尔州，这两个以白人为主的州都在 2020 年拒绝了他。

;

;“这是对黑人力量的承认。强大的民权组织全国有色人种协进会 (NAACP) 主席德里克·约翰逊 (Derrick Johnson) 表示：“通过在南卡罗来纳州拉开战斗来投票。”

;

;

;“但我们必须考虑初选和大选中发生的情况：上周四到五个百分点的变动，甚至在过去的三到四天内。”

;

;“有很大一部分选民会寻求他们认为‘两害相权取其轻’的办法，”他说，并补充说，关键在于选民是否关注米雷的波动性或马萨认为的经济失败。

; Fri, 10 Nov 2023 19:25:03 +0800 NASA probe to observe near-Earth asteroid“s 2029 close encounterhttps://reuters.com/article/space-exploration-asteroid/nasa-probe-to-observe-near-earth-asteroids-2029-close-encounter-idUSKBN3250O5

;

;天文学家预测，大约 5-1/2 年后，将出现一颗与帝国大厦一样宽的小行星高大的天体将在距地球 20,000 英里（32,200 公里）以内的太空中划过，这是现代历史上最接近我们星球的同等大小的天体。

;

;届时，美国宇航局 (NASA) 发射的一艘航天器预计 2016 年能够对这种罕见的近距离接触进行详细检查。

;

;这项由亚利桑那大学科学家指导的任务预计将深入了解行星的形成和知识，从而为以下方面的努力提供帮助：建立防御系统，防止末日小行星与地球相撞。

;

;2004 年发现时，小行星阿波菲斯（以古埃及神话中代表邪恶和混乱的恶魔蛇命名）似乎构成了可怕的威胁科学家预测 2029 年可能会发生碰撞。经过精确的观测，至少在一个世纪内排除了任何撞击风险。

;

;不过，它在 2029 年的下一次接近将把这颗小行星带入宇宙范围内。地球的猫须 - 距我们的距离不到月球的十分之一，并且位于一些地球同步地球卫星的轨道内。

;

;现在前往与阿波菲斯会合的航天器是 OSIRIS-REx，它成为了头条新闻三年前从另一颗小行星上采集土壤样本，并将其送回地球 ;一个太空舱;;降落伞着陆; 9 月在犹他州。

;

;NASA 并没有让这艘航天器退役，而是将其重新命名为 OSIRIS-APEX（APophis EXplorer 的缩写），并启动推进器，使其驶向下一个目标。

;

;;行星科学杂志;.

;

;阿波菲斯呈椭圆形，有点像花生形状，是一颗石质小行星，据信主要由硅酸盐材料以及铁和镍组成。副首席研究员迈克尔·诺兰表示，它的直径约为 1,110 英尺（340 米），预计将于 2029 年 4 月 13 日经过距地球表面约 19,800 英里（31,860 公里）的范围，并在几个小时内肉眼可见。亚利桑那大学的任务。

;

;“这不会是一场辉煌的表演，”诺兰说，但它会以非洲和欧洲夜空中反射阳光的一个点的形式出现。< /p>;

;一颗这么大的小行星距离地球如此之近，估计大约每 7,500 年就会出现一次。阿波菲斯飞越是第一次提前预测到的此类遭遇。

;

;地球引力的潮汐力可能会对小行星的表面和运动造成可测量的干扰，从而改变其轨道路径和自转。潮汐力可能会引发阿波菲斯上的山体滑坡，并移动岩石和尘埃颗粒，形成彗星般的尾巴。

;

;航天器将在这颗小行星接近并最终追上阿波菲斯时观察它飞越地球的情况。这些图像和数据将与地面望远镜测量相结合，以检测和量化阿波菲斯经过地球时如何改变。

;

;OSIRIS-APEX 计划在阿波菲斯附近停留 18 个月 - 绕轨道运行、机动围绕它，甚至悬停在它的表面上，使用火箭推进器踢起松散的物质并揭示下面的东西。

;

;像其他小行星一样，阿波菲斯是早期太阳系的遗迹。它的矿物学和化学性质在超过 45 亿年的时间里基本没有变化，为像地球这样的岩石行星的起源和发展提供了线索。

;

;对阿波菲斯的仔细检查可以为行星防御专家提供有关其结构和其他方面的宝贵信息。小行星的特性。科学家对此类天体“碎石堆”的成分、密度和轨道行为了解得越多，设计出有效的小行星偏转策略来减轻撞击威胁的机会就越大。

;

;NASA ;去年，一艘航天器故意撞向一颗小小行星;行星防御测试将岩石物体推离其正常路径，标志着人类第一次改变天体的自然运动。

;

;阿波菲斯比那颗小行星大得多，但与撞击的小行星相比很小6600 万年前的地球，;消灭了恐龙;。<诺兰说，虽然不足以对地球上的生命构成生存威胁，但一颗阿波菲斯大小的小行星以高超音速撞击地球仍然可能摧毁一个主要城市或地区，并通过海洋撞击引发海啸。< /p>;

;“从大规模灭绝的意义上来说，这不会是全球性的灾难”，但影响“肯定会属于不良影响，”诺兰说。

;

;“这件事是如果它击中的话，就会以每秒许多英里的速度飞来。在这样的速度下，无论它是由砾石、冰、岩石还是其他什么东西构成，它都无关紧要。它只是一个又大又重的东西，移动得很快。”诺兰补充道。

;Palestinian officials said 10,812 Gaza residents had been killed as of Thursday, about 40% of them children, in air and artillery strikes.

;

;Israel says 1,400 people were killed, mostly civilians, and about 240 taken hostage by Hamas in the Oct.7 raid that triggered its assault. Israel says it has lost 39 soldiers in Gaza.

;

;Ashraf Al-Qidra, spokesman for the Gaza health ministry, said Israel had bombed buildings of Al Shifa hospital five times since Thursday night.

;

;"They shelled the maternity department and the outpatient clinics building. One Palestinian was killed and several were wounded in the early morning attack," he told Reuters.

;

;In the wake of the blasts, witnesses said many people were starting to leave the grounds of the facility, fearing further strikes.

;

;But Qidra said it was impossible to clear it completely.

;

;"There is no way that we can evacuate, there is no practical way of doing it too. We are talking about 45 babies in incubators, 52 children in intensive care units, hundreds of wounded and patients, and tens of thousands of displaced people," he said.

;

;Palestinian media showed video footage of the aftermath of the Al Shifa strike, with people shouting and crying and several figures covered with blood. Reuters confirmed the location as the covered, outdoor area near the hospital's outpatient department.

;

;A World Heath Organization spokesperson said she did not have details of Friday's incident but quoted colleagues from the hospital as saying it had been coming under bombardment and there was "intense violence" at the site.

;

;Palestinian Health Minister Mai Alkaila said an adult was killed and a child was wounded at Al Shifa, one of several medical facilities hit.

;

;"Israel...targeted at dawn a number of hospitals in the Gaza Strip," her statement said.

;

;Speaking earlier to Al Jazeera television, ministry spokesman Qidra said strikes on the hospital grounds at Rantisi had set vehicles on fire but they had been partly extinguished.

;

;A person who said they were a member of staff of Nasser Children's Hospital posted an appeal on social media.

;

;"We are blockaded inside the hospital by tanks, and we are exposed to heavy fire against us. We don't have electricity, no oxygen for patients, no fresh water or salt. The situation here is very difficult and dangerous," it said.

;

;Indonesia said there were explosions near the Indonesian Hospital overnight, which damaged parts of the hospital, located at the northern end of the narrow coastal enclave. It did not say who was responsible for the explosion and it did not report any deaths or injuries.

;

;"Indonesia once again condemns the savage attacks on civilians and civilian objects, especially humanitarian facilities in Gaza," its foreign ministry said in a statement.

;

;Gaza's health ministry has said 18 of Gaza's 35 hospitals and 40 other health centres were out of service either due to damage from shelling or lack of fuel.

;

;"With ongoing strikes and fighting nearby (Al Shifa), we are gravely concerned about the well-being of thousands of civilians there, many children among them, seeking medical care and shelter," Human Rights Watch posted on social media.

;

;Israel's military advance on central Gaza City, which brought tanks within about 1.2 kilometre (3/4 mile) of Shifa, according to residents, has raised questions about how Israel will interpret international laws on protecting medical centres and displaced people sheltering there.

;

;The Israeli military has allowed some wounded Palestinian civilians to cross into Egypt for treatment and has announced daily windows for civilians to flee northern Gaza for the south.

;

;Deadly air strikes on ;refugee camps;, a medical convoy and near hospitals have already prompted fierce arguments among some of Israel's ;Western allies; over its military's adherence to international law.

;

;UN agencies have issued regular calls for a ceasefire, which both sides have rejected. UN High Commissioner for Human Rights Turk said any use of civilians by Palestinian armed groups to shield themselves would contravene the laws of war but that such conduct did not absolve Israel of its obligation to spare civilians.

;

;Israeli government spokesperson Eylon Levy posted a statement saying: "Your daily reminder that Hamas HQ is located in the basement of the Shifa Hospital, and that under international law, this exposes it to lose its protected status and become a legitimate target."

;Cuban watchmaker Ernesto Barrios saw an opportunity to make up for lost time two years ago after authorities lifted a ban on private companies that had been in place since shortly after Fidel Castro's 1959 revolution.

;

;Taking advantage of the new regulations, he founded "Tiempo de Luz," the only business in Cuba, he said, dedicated to the production and sale of wristwatches, table and wall clocks assembled from discarded timepieces and recycled, locally available materials.

;

;"We're occupying an empty niche," the 41-year-old Barrios told Reuters on a recent tour of his Havana shop, where his employees assembled, with painstaking care, watches from pieces scavenged from old clocks and raw materials, woods, leather and natural fibers found on the Caribbean island.

;

;"We don't have to import any of our materials," he said.

;

;Cuba for decades benefited from close ties with the Soviet Union, allowing them to import goods from abroad, but after the bloc's collapse in 1991 many products once common on the island, including watches, all but disappeared from state stores.

;

;"Years ago there was a great diversity of Russian watches in Cuba and today that watch market is empty," he said.

;

;More recently, food, fuel and medicine shortages have forced both the state and a growing number of small private businesses to focus on the basics, like construction, food production and tourism, though Barrios says his four-person company is making headway, despite some trouble with funding and financing.

;

;His "Made in Cuba" watches, he said, are on display in various hotels in Havana, as well as in some stores in the Cuban capital.

;Wall Street futures were mixed on Friday after Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell's hawkish tone dampened hopes of an end to rate hikes, with investors now looking forward to next week's economic reports for more cues on the monetary policy path.

;

;Powell on Thursday ;said; central bank officials "are not confident" that interest rates are yet high enough to finish the battle with inflation and would not hesitate to tighten policy further if needed.

;

;The hawkish comments sent US Treasury yields surging and ended a strong run of gains on Wall Street which had been driven by expectations that the Fed was done with its hiking cycle after the central bank kept rates unchanged at its last meeting.

;

;The S&P 500 ;(.SPX); and the Nasdaq ;(.IXIC); snapped their longest winning streak in two years in the previous session.

;

;At 5:17 am ET, Dow e-minis were up 53 points, or 0.16%, S&P 500 e-minis were up 0.25 points, or 0.01%, and Nasdaq 100 e-minis were down 29.5 points, or 0.19%.

;

;"With markets having been remarkably jittery in the wake of Powell's appearance, the market confidence seen of late clearly stands on relatively unstable presumptions," said Joshua Mahony, chief market analyst at Scope Markets.

;

;However, with inflation likely to continue its downward trend, "there is a strong chance that we see rates remain steady from here on in," Mahony adds.

;

;Traders have priced in an about 60% chance of a rate cut by the Fed at the June meeting compared to about 70% before Powell spoke, according to the CME Group's FedWatch tool.

;

;While this week has been light in terms of economic data, investors will get reports on consumer and producer prices as well as retail sales next week, which will further shape interest rate expectations ahead of the Fed's December meeting.

;

;The University of Michigan is set to issue a preliminary reading on its consumer sentiment index for November at 10 am ET.

;

;Megacap growth stocks Alphabet ;(GOOGL.O);, Nvidia ;(NVDA.O); and Tesla ;(TSLA.O); fell between 0.5% and 1.5% in premarket trading.

;Among individual stocks, Plug Power ;(PLUG.O); slumped 28.8% after the hydrogen fuel-cell firm's third-quarter revenue missed estimates.

;;Illumina; ;(ILMN.O); shares dropped 11.2% as the gene-testing company trimmed its full-year profit forecast for the second straight quarter.
